intro: Lepidaploa luetzelburgii, commonly known as the Luetzelburg's lepidaploa, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
